metadata.name: File Download Via Nscurl - MacOS
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of the nscurl utility in order to download files.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/nscurl')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--download ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--download-directory ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--output ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-dir ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-dl ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-ld')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-o '))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of the nscurl utility in order to download files.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of nscurl by administrators and users. References: https://www.loobins.io/binaries/nscurl/, https://www.agnosticdev.com/content/how-diagnose-app-transport-security-issues-using-nscurl-and-openssl, https://gist.github.com/nasbench/ca6ef95db04ae04ffd1e0b1ce709cadd
